intro: Seseli fragile, commonly known as slender seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine or arctic regions. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Seseli fragile is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
